Description: Here's a very rare 1986 left-handed model '62-reissue genuine Fender Custom Telecaster in its factory thin Candy Apple Red metal flake finish with original A serial Ashtray bridge, and original pickups that sound fantastic. This entire guitar is upgraded with all cloth wiring throughout and a highly useful "series mod" via toggle switch, giving you both pickups together with a louder, fatter humbucker like tone. The A-serial ashtray bridge is original and includes vintage style ashtray cover.The C profile maple neck is original with thickness of .81”/.87”, with a pro installed 42.3mm aged bone nut, pro re-fret with 6100 Fender Jumbo frets, and a 9.5” radius, pencil date on neck heel, Tadeo Taper, and the original G. Gotoh Kluson tuners. It is set up with D’addarrio Jazz Light Flatwound Warm Mellow guitar strings 12/52 and a medium action. In 1986, this guitar sold new for the equivalent of $1500+, and in 1990, $1600+ without hard case or upgrades. This guitar was made at a time when Fender was not making guitars in the USA, and the quality of this guitar rivals the current Fender Custom Shop models upwards of $4500. This guitar will be securely packed and shipped in a free deluxe hard shell case, with full insurance and signature confirmation.I offer fast same-day handling and 13+ years on eBay. Please view my 100% positive feedback and buy with confidence.Each guitar from my collection is unique, and once sold, its history. Don't hesitate, buy it now today!
Title: Lefty '86 Vintage Fender 62 Custom Telecaster Candy Apple Red Tele Guitar Relic
ConditionDescription: Extremely rare 1986 genuine Fender Custom Telecaster with series mod. Light finish wear and surface scratches, overall good vintage condition, and a 100% authentic natural relic. The guitar body has Nashville routes and all copper foil tape shielding throughout.
